00024 static Lexicon l;

00026 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00027 {
00028         if (argc < 3)
00029         {
00030                 cerr << "ERROR: not enough parameters" << endl << "Usage: " << argv[0] << " translation reference" << endl;
00031                 return 0; // EXIT_FAILURE;
00032         }
00033 
00034         // open files
00035         ifstream trans(argv[1]);
00036         ifstream ref(argv[2]);
00037         if (!trans.good())
00038         {
00039                 cerr << "ERROR: Opening translation ("<< argv[1] <<") failed." << endl;
00040                 return 1; // EXIT_FAILURE;
00041         }
00042         if (!ref.good())
00043         {
00044                 cerr << "ERROR: Opening reference ("<< argv[2] <<") failed." << endl;
00045                 return 1; // EXIT_FAILURE;
00046         }
00047 
00048         string  trans_line                              = "",
00049                 ref_line                                = "";
00050         double  average_levenshtein_dist                = 0,
00051                 average_posindependent_levenshtein_dist = 0;
00052 
00053         // read trans and ref and calculate the ratings
00054         unsigned int    sentenceCount           = 0;
00055         Levenshtein*    sentence50_lev          = NULL;
00056         string          sentence50_trans        = "",
00057                         sentence50_ref          = "";
00058 
00059         while (getline(trans, trans_line) && getline(ref, ref_line))
00060         {
00061                 vector<unsigned int> current_trans = l.insertSentence(trans_line);
00062                 vector<unsigned int> current_ref   = l.insertSentence(ref_line);
00063 
00064                 Bleu        *current_bleu = new Bleu       (current_trans, current_ref);
00065                 Levenshtein *current_lev  = new Levenshtein(current_trans, current_ref);
00066 
00067                 // sort line to calculate the pos-independent Levinshtein-Distance
00068                         vector<string> trans_line_vec = stringSplit(trans_line, " ");
00069                         vector<string> ref_line_vec   = stringSplit(ref_line  , " ");
00070 
00071                         sort( trans_line_vec.begin(), trans_line_vec.end() );
00072                         sort( ref_line_vec.begin()  , ref_line_vec.end()   );
00073 
00074                         vector<unsigned int> current_trans_sorted = l.insertSentence(trans_line_vec);
00075                         vector<unsigned int> current_ref_sorted   = l.insertSentence(ref_line_vec);
00076 
00077                 Levenshtein *current_posindependent_lev = new Levenshtein(current_trans_sorted, current_ref_sorted);
00078 
00079                 // sums for avg distances
00080                 average_levenshtein_dist                += current_lev->getDistance();
00081                 average_posindependent_levenshtein_dist += current_posindependent_lev->getDistance();
00082 
00083                 // output
00084                 cout    << "\n***\nBLEU-Score:\t\t"     << current_bleu->bleuScore(MAX_N_GRAMS)
00085                         << "\nLevenshtein:\t\t"         << current_lev->getDistance()
00086                         << "\npos-ind. Levenshtein:\t"  << current_posindependent_lev->getDistance()
00087                         << "\n\t t: " << trans_line
00088                         << "\n\t r: " << ref_line
00089                         << endl;
00090 
00091                 sentenceCount++;
00092 
00093                 if (sentenceCount==50)
00094                 {
00095                         sentence50_lev   = current_lev;
00096                         sentence50_trans = trans_line;
00097                         sentence50_ref   = ref_line;
00098                 }
00099         }
00100 
00101         // Output for sentence 50:
00102 
00103         cout    << "\n***\n\n***\nSentence50:\nLevenshtein:\t\t" << sentence50_lev->getDistance()
00104                 << "\nLevenshtein-Path:\t" << sentence50_lev->getPathOps()
00105                 << "\n" << sentence50_lev->getPath(l)
00106                 << "\n\t t: " << sentence50_trans
00107                 << "\n\t r: " << sentence50_ref
00108                 << endl;
00109 
00110         // Output the avarages
00111         average_levenshtein_dist                /= (double)sentenceCount;
00112         average_posindependent_levenshtein_dist /= (double)sentenceCount;
00113 
00114         cout    << "\n***\n\n***\naverage levenshtein distance: "     << average_levenshtein_dist
00115                 << "\naverage pos.independent levenshtein distance: " << average_posindependent_levenshtein_dist
00116                 << endl;
00117 
00118         return 0; //EXIT_SUCCESS;
00119 }
